intro: Lindackeria dentata, commonly known as the toothed lindackeria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with distinctive toothed margins, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Lindackeria dentata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
